description:
⁠⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
It’s totally normal to want to feel in control.  Control gives us a sense of safety and security.  When we think about all of the things that are out of our control, we usually experience fear, worry, doubt, & anger.  Trying to control things is a way of coping with anxiety and fear. ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
The problem with trying to control things to gain a sense of certainty is that many things are actually out of our control.  Things that are out of our control that we often resist include: What others think, what others say, what others feel, what others do, the weather, the past, the future, traffic, outcomes, change.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
It’s important to get clear on what we can control and what we can’t.  The more time we spend trying to control the things that are out of our control and worrying about it, the the more frustrated and disempowered we feel.  And the less we are able to truly enjoy life. ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Some things that are confused for control but are not control: Responsibility, setting & holding boundaries, and making requests.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
What are some other ways control shows up in your life? ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Let’s #healtogether
